items.headline: Inflation Fears and AI Disruption Weigh Heavily on Markets
items.summary: U.S. stocks are sinking on Friday, marking a tumultuous end to February, as investors grapple with hotter-than-expected inflation data and escalating concerns over the disruptive impact of artificial intelligence on various sectors. Geopolitical tensions related to U.S.-Iran talks are also contributing to a cautious sentiment, pushing oil prices higher. Pre-market futures for major indices had signaled a weaker opening, with Nvidia's significant drop setting a negative tone for technology shares.

items.headline: Dell Surges on Strong AI Server Outlook
items.summary: Dell Technologies ($DELL) shares were up more than 11% in premarket trading, extending to a gain of +$20.48, after the company reported robust Q4 earnings and projected a doubling of its AI server revenue in fiscal year 2027. The company also announced a 20% dividend hike and a $10 billion stock buyback program.

items.headline: Netflix Rises After Exiting Warner Bros. Bid
items.summary: Netflix ($NFLX) saw its shares climb approximately $8 in premarket trading. The surge came after the company reportedly walked away from a deal to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery's studio, following a raised bid from Paramount.

items.headline: Block Inc. Gains on Workforce Reduction News
items.summary: Block Inc. ($SQ) gained +$8.48, as investors reacted to CEO Jack Dorsey's announcement of a nearly 50% workforce reduction, attributing the move to the efficiency brought by AI tools.

items.headline: Nvidia Leads Tech Sell-off Amid AI Concerns
items.summary: Nvidia ($NVDA) shares dropped 5.6% in early Friday trading, contributing significantly to the broader tech sector's decline. The semiconductor giant's results, while beating forecasts, failed to sustain the intense artificial intelligence-driven momentum, leading investors to unwind crowded AI positions.

items.headline: Salesforce Shares Decline Despite Positive Earnings
items.summary: Salesforce ($CRM) shares fell 3.7% on Friday, paring back most of its 4% gain from the previous day. Despite reporting better-than-expected profits, investor sentiment turned negative amid broader market concerns.

items.headline: Zoom Communications Plunges on Mixed Q4 Earnings Reaction
items.summary: Zoom Communications ($ZM) experienced a sharp decline of 11.58% following its Q4 earnings report, as guidance and margin commentary drew mixed reactions from investors.

items.headline: Wholesale Inflation Surges, Exceeding Expectations
items.summary: The Producer Price Index (PPI) for January rose 0.5%, surpassing the anticipated 0.3% increase. Even more concerning, core PPI, excluding volatile food and energy prices, jumped 0.8%, double the 0.3% rise analysts expected. This data has fueled fears that the Federal Reserve may maintain higher interest rates for a longer period.

items.headline: U.S.-Iran Talks Collapse, Pushing Oil Prices Higher
items.summary: U.S.-Iran nuclear discussions in Geneva concluded without an agreement, intensifying geopolitical risks and contributing to a rise in oil prices. Brent crude, the international benchmark, jumped 2.7% to US$72.73 per barrel. This escalation adds further inflationary pressure to the global economy.

items.headline: Sector Rotation Amid AI Disruption Fears
items.summary: The technology and communication services sectors led declines, while the Financials Select Sector SPDR ($XLF) showed resilience, rising 1.3% on Thursday. Investors are rotating out of software companies and other businesses perceived as vulnerable to artificial intelligence disruption. The Philadelphia Semiconductor Index declined 3.2%, threatening its 10-week winning streak, as investors unwound crowded AI positions.

items.headline: Key Earnings Reports and Market Reactions
items.summary: Beyond Dell and Salesforce, several companies are scheduled to report earnings today, including Endeavour Silver ($EXK), Globalstar ($GSAT), Hawaiian Electric ($HE), and Gogo ($GOGO). Earlier, Zoom Communications ($ZM) dropped 11.58% and Everpure ($PSTG) fell 10.30% after their respective Q4 earnings reports.
